ovdesc.p: This table is used to define accounting events used by the soft accounting processing where the event is used to identify mapping tables to determine the type of accounting entries to raise and the content of these entries.
The accounting event will be supplied either by the underlying application. An identifying code will be supplied as part of the event interface information from the underlying application.

desc.p: The target balance associated with the event type.
This field is sub-valued and can be expanded to allow multiple movements to be raised.
The values allowed when MVMT.DETAIL is set to STMT are:
BAL*BALANCE.TYPE key
Soft Balance Type (Defined in AC.BALANCE.TYPE)
INT*ACCOUNT.CLASS key
AccountClass for posting to an internal account of the specified class in event currency
INTLCY*ACCOUNT.CLASS key
AccountClass for posting to an internal account in local currency of the specified class.
AC*ACCOUNT key
account number for posting to a specific account number.
TXN*
Contract id to be mapped from the supplied event information
The values allowed when MVMT.DETAIL is set to CATEG are:
PL*CATEGORY key
category code for profit and loss posting
The values allowed when MVMT.DETAIL is set to SPECIAL are:
CRB
TXN indicating that the contract of the event will be used.
No Input allowed if the MVMT.DETAIL is not populated.

An optional identifier to allow the allocation associated only when the event type supplied with the accounting event matches. A null value will be assumed to be the default value. No duplicate values allowed. The applications should document the structure of their accounting events to allow this table to be configured correctly. Could be another sub-table.
Multi Valued
A valid AC.EVENT record is allowed.
The key to the AC.ALLOCATION.RULE table, this will be passed as the RULE_ID field of a soft accounting event.
A soft accounting event is comprised of the following: -
E_TransactionID

The transaction (e.g. FT, TT) reference of the deal moving funds to the contract. For AA generated movements it will be the AA transaction reference. If not supplied the contract will be assumed as the transaction.
E_TransactionSysId
The system id of the transaction. If not supplied the contract system id will be assumed.
E_ContractId
For AA the contract is the account/arrangement number.
E_ContractSysId
The system id of the contract
E_RuleId
The allocation rule key to use in building the entries
E_EventType
The type of event within the same rule. Can be used to distinguish between PL current, PL Prev Month etc
E_EventCcy
The currency of the supplied event details
E_Sign
The sign of event amounts
E_Amount
The movement amount for the contract in contract ccy. Unsigned
E_AmountLcy
The local currency equivalent of the movement amount. If not supplied will be calculated using the mid-rate for the currency.
E_Exchrate
The exchange rate used to calculate the local currency equivalent. If not supplied will be calculated.
E_ValueDate
The Value Date for the accounting event
E_ExposureDate
The ExposureDate for the accounting event
E_BalSubType
The sub type to be used for the event in the update of the balances (depends on balance type). For AA this could be the due date
E_ReversalInd
Indicates if the event is a reversal
